name: Constellations
description: Raffi Musiker has arrived from a time where Starfleet was full of secrets. As she uncovers the history of the U.S.S. Discovery, what will the Federation make of the synthetic officer Airiam's actions?
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Raffi, Nhan, Airiam, Cyberneticists, or Soji will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Raffi, Nhan, Airiam, Soji, or Cyberneticists
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

adventures.name: Security Feeds
adventures.description: Comb through security feeds from the ship itself.

adventures.name: Personal Log
adventures.description: Dive into the personal logs of Discovery's crew.

adventures.name: Starfleet Records
adventures.description: Compare data from Discovery to official Starfleet record.

rewards.name: Constellations
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.name: Restricted Access
adventures.description: Use Romulan Star Empire methods to ice out Raffi's access.

adventures.name: Who Watches
adventures.description: Learn about Romulan Star Empire intelligence methods.

adventures.name: Commander Musiker
adventures.description: Explore Raffi's Starfleet career with Romulan Star Empire help.

rewards.name: Constellations
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.name: Weighted Invitation
adventures.description: Have Section 31 trap Raffi with easily accessed data.

adventures.name: Spam Calls
adventures.description: Repeatedly contact Raffi on Section 31 channels.

adventures.name: The Discovery Connection
adventures.description: Cross-reference the Discovery with Raffi's life.

adventures.name: The Discovery Connection

goals.flavor: Shed light on the truth with the Federation.

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "I'd wonder if this temporal anomaly crisis was one big conspiracy, but then I blinked and found myself here. Stone-cold sober, on top of it."
"This isn't the worst thing that could have happened to us. The synthetic ban never happened here... and hopefully never will."
"Hmph. Well, plenty of other things have, and some of it Starfleet doesn't want us to know about. I plan on getting caught up--starting with the Discovery and her crew."

"We have nothing to hide, Commander. We'll help you in any way that we can, as will the captain of this vessel. But please remember there was a reason Starfleet wanted the Discovery wiped from the history books...."
"Captain, we're concerned about Raffi. She's completely shut us out of her efforts to reconstruct Discovery's service log."
"I'm guessing she doesn't like what she sees. A paranoid sort, isn't she?"

responses.text: "I don't know the full history of the Discovery, what could she object to?"
"Are we certain she isn't just underwater in a bar somewhere?"

screens.text: "Raffi has good reason to be paranoid. In our time, Starfleet was infiltrated by Romulan agents who engineered a mass murder of both Federation citizens and their own people just because they were afraid of synthetics."
"I'm a person, like you. I don't know how much it matters what's under our skin."
"A Klingon agent infiltrating Starfleet, a rogue AI almost destroying the galaxy... nothing, really."
"Raffi has been through things you can't imagine. She's a good person who believes in the values of the Federation. She just knows that Starfleet can't always be trusted to uphold them."

"Some of Raffi's comm logs indicate that she might be getting help from the Romulans. Section 31 would rather Raffi stop, and I worry how far they're willing to go to do that. But I'm not ashamed of anything we've done. I'd like to help her--if we can find out what she's after."
